intro: Lysionotus metuoensis subsp. metuoensis, commonly known as the Metuo endemic, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in East Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant has elliptical leaves with a smooth surface and is often found in moist, shaded habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
